QAPair.Question: What is (are) Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Alström syndrome is a very rare disease. It is passed down through families (inherited). This disease can lead to blindness , deafness , diabetes , and obesity .

QAPair.Question: What causes Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Alström syndrome is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner. This means both of your parents must pass on a copy of the defective gene (ALMS1) in order for you to have this disease. It is unknown how the defective gene causes the disorder. The condition is very rare.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Common symptoms of this condition are: Blindness or severe vision impairment in infancy, Dark patches of skin (acanthosis nigricans), Deafness, Impaired heart function ( cardiomyopathy ), which may lead to heart failure, Obesity, Progressive kidney failure, Slowed growth, Symptoms of childhood-onset or type 2 diabetes , Occasionally, the following can also occur: Gastrointestinal reflux, Hypothyroidism , Liver dysfunction, Small penis ,

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: An eye doctor (ophthalmologist) will examine the eyes. The person may have reduced vision. Tests may be done to check: Blood sugar levels (to diagnose high blood sugar or hyperglycemia ), Hearing, Heart function, Thyroid function, Triglyceride levels ,

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: There is no specific treatment for this syndrome. Treatment for symptoms may include: Diabetes medicine, Hearing aids, Heart medicine, Thyroid hormone replacement ,

QAPair.Question: Where to find support for people with Alstrm syndrome ?
What is the outlook for Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: The following are likely to develop: Deafness, Permanent blindness, Type 2 diabetes , Kidney and liver failure may get worse.

QAPair.Question: What are the complications of Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Possible complications are: Complications from diabetes, Coronary artery disease (from diabetes and high cholesterol), Fatigue and shortness of breath (if poor heart function is not treated) ,

Question.qtype: when to contact a medical professional

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Alstrm syndrome ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your health care provider if you or your child has symptoms of diabetes. Common symptoms of diabetes are increased thirst and urination. Seek medical attention right away if you think that your child cannot see or hear normally.
